positive.review:
If your friend suggests you to buy this game, think twice. 
They may not play it right after you purchase it. 

(My friend, you know who you are)
Great party game. I have an absolute blast each time I play this.
i think this game is rather exciting, the games and the board are unique. good job team.

This is a perfect game for people that really enjoy Mario Party concept, the game has a lot of charm, but is missing stand out features like certain item that could really add to the strategy to the game like a double dice or a backwards dice. 

The steam workshop helps make this game way better than It already is, it allows an unlimited source of free maps, which some are amazingly made and some are very poor. The mini games are alright, some are very poorly made and I find myself turning a lot of them off. In the settings you should be able to choose how many keys each mini game gives you, as that would be a fun thing to change around.

I would give Pummel Party a solid 7.8 out of 10. Its the best party based game on Steam, but the selection is quite sparse.

Play it every thanksgiving with the boys and its a blast every time. Maybe the distance between sessions contributes to that but either way very enjoyable. It also enables tons of extra minigames to introduce via the workshop which is cool to check out and tailor to your group which I like.

This is probably one of the best party games on Steam, BUT the developers have pretty much abandoned this, and left it up to the unpaid workshop developers to carry it through the years, which would not be such a bad thing if the developers would listen to their workshop developers, and help them bring more quality content to the player base.

WE WANT TO MAKE CONTENT FOR YOUR GAME, but you are unwilling to help us do it.... for that. we cry. Engage with your community and you will get a ton more sales..... or let the best party game on steam.... die.
fun game, chaotic and keeps it fresh
only 2 hours into this game and its an absolute BLAST to have with a few friends and some controllers. 10/10. BETTER THAN MARIO PARTY BY FAR!
Shitty unfair, poorly optimized games in between. Other than that, pretty good.

If you loved Mario Party growing up and you ate now an adult, this game is Adult Mario Party. The rage you use to feel toward your siblings, or friends while playing Mario Party also happens here. Fun game to play with friends and the mod support is awesome. Full recommend!

My friends keep asking when we are gonna play this next! Bought this on a whim knowing it looked similar to Mario Party. My friends and I have been looking for a game to play that was a party game and this is very much it. We played one full game and it was a blast!

Like Mario Party, but for grown-ups (or people you call friends, who you then hate after).

Fun game.
Like Mario Party but for adults. Very well done and the developers have really brought this game to life with update after update. Highly recommend.
This game is great with a lot of friends, i recommend playing it on fast paced mode the ragdoll and speed makes it all the better
This game is actually amazing, It brings that party multiplayer minigame to a more humorous and grotesque gameplay. Would reccomend!

It would be really cool if you added more maps to the minigames ‚Äî especially the race ones. After a while you start to notice that people who already know every corner of the existing maps win almost automatically, while beginners struggle a lot just trying to keep up.

Plus, when you‚Äôve played for a bit, running through the same minigames again and again gets a little repetitive. A few extra map variations would definitely help keep things fresh, make the races less predictable, and give new players a better chance to adapt.
ive laughed my balls of with this game. Terrific job guys! xoxo

If you hate your friends this is your game!
The best friend loosing game.

Ever play Mario party and wish you could just off your opponent? Well, here you go. If someone told me a highschool kid made this in a computer programming elective, I would have believed it. The scope is small and will get old after a few rounds once you keep getting the same few minigames but its awesome to have for the occasional round with siblings. I got a lot of laughs out of this for $15. If you don't have a group to play with, this wont be half as fun.
PEAK 10/10. NO THIS IS NOT A REVIEW FOR THE GAME PEAK.
FUN WITH FRIENDS. AND BY FUN, I MEAN I HATE MY FRIENDS
Enjoyed the excitement of playing 8 player mode! Keep up the good job.

How to lose your friends 101. Would lose my friends again!

8/10
great fun especially when drinking
I love getting gangbanged by my friends

Great game, hope they keep updating it
very good with friends and family

The board game part is fine, the mini games are fine, some are even quite good on their own. However this is unbelievable value for a ‚Äúbully your friends into crying‚Äù experience.

If your friend suggests you to buy this game, think twice. 
They may not play it right after you purchase it. 

(My friend, you know who you are)
Mario party with guns. Hurry up and play it before Nintendo sues them and makes them take it down.

Good game to have some fun with friends. Most maps are fun to play and the minigames are mostly interesting and well designed. Additionally you add player made minigames from the steam workshop to your game, which is also a very nice addition.
This game is soo fun it never gets old! Can get chaotic and messy!
If you and your friends want chaos, trash talk, and endless fun, Pummel Party is your game 10/10.

This is a solid 8.5/10, there are 54 mini games, and 8 playable maps in the base version. Then you con obtain at least 300 extra mini games and maps through workshop of varying degrees of quality. This is the closest you'll get to a "Good Mario Party" game on Steam, it's cool it supports up to 8 players, and is much better than "Party Panic" as a Mario Party esque game. 

It has a few problems though, you only get 15 seconds for your turn to keep things fast, and you cannot extend this at all. So if you're playing with friends for the first time, I guarantee you they'll complain about how they're not given any time to figure out what the weapons do, and whatnot. Some of the base minigames are hit or miss with janky mechanics, so it's rough around the edges for sure.

Apart from that, I do think this is a terrific game party game, and at just 15$, it's a must have if you like to like to play locally. Achievements are fun and challenging to get, so going for 100% should be a great time too.
Great party game. I have an absolute blast each time I play this.
It‚Äôs a fun mix of chaos and strategy with friends, and I‚Äôd recommend it to others for the endless laughs and competitive moments it creates

Got this back in 2020 when we was forced to stay in our homes and I played it with my friends and my wife, and I remember we used to have a lot of fun playing it. Also it had remote share meaning other people could join us who didn't own the game. Played it once recently and did enjoy it. Having less time and wanting to play other games is why I am not playing it recently, but that does that change the fact the game was worth it.
i think this game is rather exciting, the games and the board are unique. good job team.

The best party game I know of, I enjoyed this more than any other variant of the same kind. My only negative criticism of this game is that if there is an experienced player, the newer players are in for a very rough time, and will likely lose motivation. I'm the experienced player in this case so my fun isn't impeded whatsoever though, 10/10.

Oh and there are a lot of loser's trophies to give the inexperienced players a winning chance, but it doesn't feel rewarding to win through them, because you know that you didn't win because you played well, nor did you enjoy yourself while getting a butt-whooping, so it feels like a bandaid fix if anything, still a good implementation though.

played it with colleagues.
cannot say it was good.
cannot say it was not fun, though.

In the settings you should be able to choose how many keys each mini game gives you, as that would be a fun thing to change around.

mas caso voc√™ prefira xingar todas as gera√ß√µes do seu amigo, aprender e criar xingamentos jamais proferidos na humanidade e perder alguns anos de sanidade mental, super recomendo
I think this is the best party game I have played on steam and if you get all your friends on it can be very funny. Minigames and maps are creative and items are fun to mess with your friends.

Sadly, not many players are playing this game. Lobbies are often empty or don‚Äôt exist at all. However the mini-games can definitely be fun. I played the game on maximum settings and had a constant 160 FPS... except for one mini-game about treasure searching, where I suddenly dropped to around 10 FPS. Not sure why that happened.

The game was fun and perfect for playing with family or friends. There are some cosmetics and a few mini-games to enjoy, but you really should play it with other people. The AI of the bots honestly isn‚Äôt great. Still, I recommend the game.

The game is so cool! These soundtrack, maps' design, character's design, minigames are awesome! Huge respect to the developer!
Fun, competitive and great to have a laugh with friends

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è An Absolute Blast with Friends ‚Äî The Ultimate Party Game Chaos!

Pummel Party is pure multiplayer mayhem at its finest! This game captures the wild, unpredictable fun of classic party games and cranks it up to eleven. Whether you‚Äôre battling through mini-games, sabotaging your friends on the board, or unleashing hilarious power-ups, every match is a riot from start to finish.

The gameplay balance is perfect ‚Äî easy for newcomers to pick up, but with just enough strategy and skill to keep things interesting. The mini-games are clever, varied, and genuinely fun, ranging from frantic reflex challenges to laugh-out-loud chaos. And the item system? Brilliant. There‚Äôs nothing quite like blasting your best friend with a rocket or zapping them off the map right before they reach a trophy.

What makes Pummel Party shine is how it never takes itself too seriously. The humor, the ridiculous physics, and the unpredictable twists keep every session fresh. It‚Äôs also regularly updated and supported by the devs, with new content and improvements that show genuine care for the community.

Whether you‚Äôre playing locally or online, this is one of those games that guarantees laughter, shouting, and unforgettable moments. It‚Äôs the perfect game for game nights, Discord hangouts, or just when you want to settle scores in the most chaotic way possible.

üéÆ 10/10 ‚Äì A hilarious, polished, and endlessly replayable party masterpiece. If you have friends, you need Pummel Party.

negative.review:
The idea is great and most of the game is too. There is just one MASSIVE issue which, in my opinion, completely messes up the experience: the player's performance in mini-games, for which you actually need to use some kind of skills, are way too unimportant when its about the (final) outcome of the game. 

If you do rather well during the mini-games yet someone else randomly finds the perfect weapon for their position on the board, you can already fall behind quite a bit. And even though this game isn't necessarily about winning at all (since there are awards to be won for doing extremely bad), it is a given that anyone winning where actual skill is involved should be rewarded for that. Other than that, the balance of on-board items is 100% something that should be looked out since I don't believe anyone actually really thought about that part much longer than a couple of hours at most.

It sure is a really fun party game but its very unrewarding to do above average so to me its not really that great as a general game experience. This is the reason of me not recommending it.

I really can't recommend this game In the current state. The core idea is nice, but the pvp sequences are incredibly laggy and everything else is just a complete bug fest.

I do not reccommend buying this game, the game is okay for one round and after it just gets incredibly repetitive and boring

all of the boards are the same theres no difference at all, all of the items are pretty much the same being just fucking someone else over.

the minigame selection is super minimal and also incredibly repetitive the minigames consist of: Shooting eachother, Hitting eachother and dodging something.

Its missing alot of features that makes games like this fun its massively missing randomness.

all in all this game sucks and is super stale i wish i could still refund.
Bugs, crawling with bugs. Do not buy without a pest control subscription.

Do not play this game if you're under 16 or any race other than white. This game is plagued by super racist regulars and with such a small player base you will run into them a lot. Unfortunately, I couldn't find a report button so I'll leave this here instead.

NEVER BEFORE IN MY LIFE HAVE I PLAYED SUCH A DOG SHIT GAME. Better hope your first turn puts you at the top of the leader board or the game literally punishes you. Winning mini games means nothing in this, if you're not at the top of the leader boards it gives you awful items (if any at all) while pandering to the people who are top of the board. Thought it was just a bad first game, but after playing again and realizing it actively screws you over if you're not in first place I can't believe I spent money on this. Save your money and get a game you'll actually enjoy.

Thought it was just a bad first game, but after playing again and realizing it actively screws you over if you're not in first place I can't believe I spent money on this. Save your money and get a game you'll actually enjoy.

The idea is great and most of the game is too. There is just one MASSIVE issue which, in my opinion, completely messes up the experience: the player's performance in mini-games, for which you actually need to use some kind of skills, are way too unimportant when its about the (final) outcome of the game. 

If you do rather well during the mini-games yet someone else randomly finds the perfect weapon for their position on the board, you can already fall behind quite a bit. And even though this game isn't necessarily about winning at all (since there are awards to be won for doing extremely bad), it is a given that anyone winning where actual skill is involved should be rewarded for that. Other than that, the balance of on-board items is 100% something that should be looked out since I don't believe anyone actually really thought about that part much longer than a couple of hours at most.

It sure is a really fun party game but its very unrewarding to do above average so to me its not really that great as a general game experience. This is the reason of me not recommending it.
